009
010package imagingbook.common.geometry.misc;
011
012import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
013import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntDouble;
014
015/**
016 * This (singleton) class is used to re-sample 2D polygons by interpolation.
017 * 
018 *  @author WB
019 *  @version 2022/10/26
020 */
021public class PolygonSampler {
022        
023        private static final PolygonSampler instance = new PolygonSampler();
024        
025        private PolygonSampler() {}
026        
027        public static PolygonSampler getInstance() {
028                return instance;
029        }
030        
031        /**
032         * Samples the closed polygon path specified by V at M
033         * equi-distant positions.
034         * 
035         * @param V the vertices of the (closed) polygon.
036         * @param M the number of sample points.
037         * @return the sample points as an array of Point objects.
038         */
039        public Pnt2d[] samplePolygonUniformly(Pnt2d[] V, int M) {
040                int N = V.length;
041                double Delta = pathLength(V) / M;       // constant segment length in Q
042                // distribute N points along polygon path P
043                Pnt2d[] S = new Pnt2d[M];
044//              S[0] = (Point) V[0].clone();            // q_0 = p_0 (duplicate p_0)
045                S[0] = PntDouble.from(V[0]);            // q_0 = p_0 (duplicate p_0)
046                int i = 0;                      // lower index of segment (i,i+1) in P
047                int j = 1;                      // index of next point to be added to Q
048                double alpha = 0;       // lower boundary of current path segment in P
049                double beta = Delta;    // path position of next point to be added to Q
050                // for all M segments in P do:
051                while (i < N && j < M) {
052                        Pnt2d vA = V[i];
053                        Pnt2d vB = V[(i + 1) % N];
054                        double delta = vA.distance(vB);
055                        // handle segment (i,i+1) with path boundaries (a,a+d), knowing a < b
056                        while (beta <= alpha + delta && j < M) {
057                                // a < b <= a+d
058                                S[j] = interpolate(vA, vB, (beta - alpha) / delta);
059                                j = j + 1;
060                                beta = beta + Delta;
061                        }
062                        alpha = alpha + delta;
063                        i = i + 1;
064                }       
065                return S;
066        }
067        
068        /**
069         * For testing only: allows to choose an arbitrary start point by
070         * setting 'startFrac' in [0,1].
071         * @param V the vertices of the (closed) polygon.
072         * @param M the number of sample points.
073         * @param startFrac the position of the first sample as a fraction of the 
074         * polggon's circumference in [0,1].
075         * @return the sample points as an array of Point objects.
076         */
077        public Pnt2d[] samplePolygonUniformly(Pnt2d[] V, int M, double startFrac) {
078                int startPos = (int) Math.round(V.length * startFrac) % V.length;
079                return samplePolygonUniformly(shiftLeft(V, startPos), M);
080        }
081        
082        private Pnt2d[] shiftLeft(Pnt2d[] V, int startPos) {
083                int polyLen = V.length;
084                Pnt2d[] P2 = new Pnt2d[polyLen]; 
085                for (int i = 0; i < P2.length; i++) {
086//                      P2[i] = (Point) V[(i + startPos) % polyLen].clone();
087                        P2[i] = PntDouble.from(V[(i + startPos) % polyLen]);
088                }
089                return P2;
090        }
091        
092        
093        private double pathLength(Pnt2d[] V) {
094                double L = 0;
095                final int N = V.length;
096                for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
097                        Pnt2d p0 = V[i];
098                        Pnt2d p1 = V[(i + 1) % N];
099                        L = L + p0.distance(p1);
100                }
101                return L;
102        }
103        
104        private Pnt2d interpolate(Pnt2d p0, Pnt2d p1, double alpha) {
105                // alpha is in [0,1]
106                double x = p0.getX() + alpha * (p1.getX() - p0.getX());
107                double y = p0.getY() + alpha * (p1.getY() - p0.getY());
108                return Pnt2d.PntDouble.from(x, y);
109        }
110        
111}
